Job Responsibilities:     - Responsible for calling Insurance companies (in US) on behalf of doctors/physicians and follow up on outstanding Accounts Receivable   - To prioritize the pending claims for calling from the aging basket   - Should be able to convince the claims company (payers) for payment of their outstanding claims.   - To check the appropriateness of the insurance information given by the patient if it is inadequate or unclear.   - To make a physical call by following the international norms and applicable rules for confidentiality and HIPAA compliance   - Escalate difficult collection situations to management in a timely manner.   - Review provider claims that have not been paid by insurance companies   - Handling patient s billing queries and updating their account information.   - Work on over 20 days work file.   - Post cash and write off the contractual adjustments accordingly while working on the accounts.   - Meeting daily/weekly and monthly targets set for an individual.    - In case the patient does not have sufficient insurance coverage for the medical procedure or if the patient is in any way not eligible for coverage, transfer the outstanding balance to the patient.    - In case the claim has already been paid by the insurance company, request insurance company/ TPA to send EOB (Explanation of Benefits) through fax/ mail.   - Sound knowledge of U.S. Healthcare Domain (Provider side)     Skills Required:     Accounts Receivables, Communication Skills, MS Office, Computer Skills, Good Team Player,     Candidate Attributes:     - Ready to work in US Shifts.   - Experience in Healthcare Revenue Cycle Management process.   - Strong written and verbal communication skills.   - Good computer skills including Microsoft Office suite.   - Ability to prioritize and manage work queue.    - Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.   - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.   - Ability to perform other responsibilities and assist with special projects.   - Ability to learn quickly and also provide training to others.   - Sharing of knowledge and best practices.   - Adherence to compliance norms.    - Good typing skills with a speed of min 30-35 words /min
column11: Claims, Analytical, Billing, HIPAA, Healthcare, Workflow, MS Office, Business intelligence, Analytics, Monitoring

Must have skills : SAP SuccessFactors Compensation Good to have skills : SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Minimum  7.5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : 15 Years Continuous Education Summary :As a Tech Delivery Subject Matter Expert for SAP SuccessFactors Compensation, you will be responsible for driving innovative practices into delivery and bringing depth of expertise to a delivery engagement. Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the design and implementation of SAP SuccessFactors Compensation solutions for clients, leveraging deep technical expertise and business acumen. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and identify opportunities for process improvement. Provide subject matter expertise on SAP SuccessFactors Compensation to clients and internal teams, serving as a trusted advisor. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Expertise in SAP SuccessFactors Compensation. Good To Have Skills:Experience with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central. Strong understanding of HR processes and best practices. Experience with SAP HCM modules and related technologies. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 7.5 years of experience in SAP SuccessFactors Compensation. column2: Program   Associate   Maharashtra   -   Akola JOB   TYPE:  Full-time LOCATION:  Maharashtra-Akola, India TEAM:  Implementation WHO   WE   ARE YosAid Innovation Foundation improves outcomes and strengthens health systems in India by promoting innovative healthcare practices and skills among the patients and their families. In collaboration with healthcare institutions and the government, YosAid Innovation Foundation provides healthcare training and actionable skill building to patients and family caregivers on health behaviours and information. WHAT   YOU   WILL   DO The objective of this role is to develop a constructive, interactive, continuous and adaptable knowledge-building system for the population accessing public healthcare. As a Program Associate, you will play a critical role in managing the engagement of the Care Companion Program with our partners. ??You want to democratize the healthcare system and are an exceptional problem-solver. You  are, of course, a team player and excellent communicator, but you are also an independent  and creative thinker, with no problem taking the reins through to completion. You are a doer  and a go-getter. ??You love checklists. You don't like to sit behind shiny glass panels building imaginary plans all day. ??You like to hit the ground running, get your hands dirty and if required, jump in knee-deep waters to not just figure out the problem, but lead from the front to solve it. www.yosaid.org    You are diplomatic, treat others with humble kindness, while possessing the confident  leadership skills necessary to build capacity on the teams that you manage. You are also  able to manage relations with government staff in a sensitive manner at the same time  ensuring their training outcomes are met. 1. Manage end-to-end operations of YosAid program at identified hospital partners (60%): ??Support Program Managers/Lead Trainers in the implementation and maintenance of  the Care Companion Program. The operations of our program are divided into different  phases that include both on-site implementation (requiring travel) and off-site support.  You will be closely involved in each of these phases. ??Be the primary coordinator for a set of partners, which can include both public and  private hospitals. This will require client management, people management, analytical  and problem-solving skills. ??Represent CCP at programme related coordination meetings and similar activities 2. Monitoring of the CCP in partner hospitals (20%) ??Quantitative Monitoring: Actively monitor the output data for the assigned hospitals and  work along with the program manager to address the operational challenges identified  during the monitoring process. ??Qualitative Monitoring: Conduct class quality audits for a randomly selected set of hospitals every month. 3. Support training of the trainer activities at identified hospital partners (10%): ??Support the Master Trainers/Lead Trainers in delivering the ToT modules for the different content areas in the local language ??Identify the need for booster training sessions and coordinate its logistics 4. Program Iterations/Product Testing(10%) ??Work with our in-house team of designers and content creators to implement our experimental design activities in the hospital partners ??Gather feedback on the experiments conducted by the team, supporting them in making various operations/content decisions WHAT   WE   ARE   LOOKING   FOR ??The position requires heavy project based travel to various district hospitals in the given  state. Travel may be for an extended duration and sometimes require relocation to another  region of the state. www.yosaid.org   ??You will be located in tier II - district headquarters of Maharashtra. ??Language criteria: Marathi, English & Hindi (applicant should have fluency in the native  language of the state and candidates without above-mentioned language proficiency  need not apply) ??Healthcare or management background (MPH, MHA, MBA, MBBS, MSW, BDS, BPT, BAMS, BUMS, with management background) ??Proficiency in MS Office/G-drive, common computer applications ??Professionals with field level experience of public health management are encouraged to apply ??1-3 years of relevant work experience. HOW   TO   APPLY Email the following materials with the subject line  Program   Associate   to   recruitment@yosaid.org  A one-page cover letter describing your interest in the position and background.  An updated resume, including languages spoken and relevant experiences. www.yosaid.org

(Candidates with relevant diplomas and extensive experience in the field will also be considered.) Proven experience and expertise in electric vehicles, including battery technologies, power electronics, electric motors, and charging systems. Prior experience in conducting training sessions, workshops, or educational programs is highly advantageous.

column2: Looking for highly skilled and experienced Programming/Data Structure Trainer .      The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering training on programming languages such as C, C++, Java and Data Structures to a diverse group of students in a classroom setting.            Key Responsibilities:              A Programming/Data Structures trainer is responsible for training students on the concepts of programming and data structures. This includes topics such as Data Structures, Algorithms, and Object-oriented programming.      The trainer should also train students on the practical implementation of data structures.        Design and deliver engaging training sessions on programming languages such as C, C++, Java, and Data Structures.        Create and maintain training materials, including lesson plans, presentations, and assessments.        Monitor student progress and provide feedback and support to ensure student success.        Collaborate with other trainers to ensure consistency in training and to share best practices.            Qualifications:              This is a full-time position, and the trainer will be expected to work with a diverse set of students including those with varying levels of programming experience.      The trainer will be expected to be up-to-date with the latest developments in programming and data structures and be familiar with a variety of programming languages.        Experience in Data Structures and programming languages (C/C++/Java).        Strong background in computer science and experience of training and mentoring students.        Strong communication skills and the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and simple way.        Strong organisational and time management skills.        Ability to work independently and as part of a team.        Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.            Education:            B.E. / B.Tech. / MCA / MSc-IT / MSc-CS / M.Tech / PhD.

column2: 1. Implementation and Integration:     Lead the implementation and integration of Neuron Tool into the existing system infrastructure.     Collaborate with IT teams to ensure seamless integration with other tools and systems.     2. Customization and Configuration:     Customize and configure Neuron Tool according to organizational requirements and workflows.     Work closely with end-users to understand specific needs and tailor the tool accordingly.     3. Training and Support:     Provide training sessions to end-users on how to effectively use the Neuron Tool.     Offer ongoing support and troubleshooting assistance to users.     4. Data Management:     Oversee data management within the Neuron Tool, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information.     Implement data quality control measures and address any discrepancies.     5. Workflow Optimization:     Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to optimize workflows using the Neuron Tool.     Identify and implement process improvements to enhance overall efficiency.     6. Reporting and Analytics:     Develop and generate reports and analytics using the Neuron Tool.     Provide insights and recommendations based on the analysis of tool-generated data.     7. System Upgrades and Maintenance:     Stay updated on Neuron Tool updates and releases.     Coordinate system upgrades and perform regular maintenance tasks.     8. Documentation:     Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to Neuron Tool configurations, workflows, and best practices.     Ensure documentation is easily accessible to relevant teams.     9. User Feedback and Continuous Improvement:     Gather user feedback on the Neuron Tools functionality and user experience.     Contribute to continuous improvement efforts based on user input and changing organizational needs.     10. Collaboration with Vendors:     Interface with Neuron Tool vendors to address technical issues, obtain support, and stay informed about new features.             Qualifications:             Proven experience in implementing and managing Neuron Tool or similar software solutions.     Strong technical skills, including customization and configuration of the Neuron Tool.     Ability to understand and optimize workflows using the Neuron Tool.     Excellent training and communication skills for user education and support.     Proficiency in data management and reporting within the Neuron Tool.     Familiarity with system upgrades, maintenance, and vendor collaboration.     Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality control.     Problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues.     Documentation skills for creating and maintaining comprehensive system documentation.     The Neuron Tool Specialist role involves a combination of technical expertise, user support, and system optimization to ensure the effective implementation and utilization of the Neuron Tool within the organization.
